page.title: 01BOXTED POEM
page.content:
Boxted Poem.
Boxted feels like Paradise With lots of animals, like cats and mice. With flowers all blooming in the spring The baby birds from the treetops fling Their bodies hoping to fly, Up into the azure sky. Over treetops brilliant green With blossoms all pink and yellow - A sight to be seen. The pond's waves gently flow As people watch and stare, then go. Boxted is my favourite village, I was brought up there since four. I've liked it and loved it Since the owner of the house Opened the door.
Rebecca McLauchlan 10y.
